intro: Scorzonera ulrichii, commonly known as the Ulrich's scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and yellow to orange flowers. The plant produces a taproot that is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Scorzonera ulrichii is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance.
